sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"考试"之意。
means: examination ： 通常指为检查学生知识或能力而举行的正式考试，有时也指临时考试。
test ： 多指有具体目的的临时性考试或小考。
quiz ： 指时间较短，随时进行的口头或书面的非正式测验。
exam系examination的缩略形式，口语用词，通俗。

word_mean: 检查，观察：尤指用于疾病的诊断，性质按其所用方法而定，如体格检查、放射检查、膀胱镜检查等

sentence.Network_en: The Navy is to carry out an examination of the wreck tomorrow.
sentence.Network_cn: 海军明天将对失事船只进行细查。

sentence.Network_en: The events in Los Angeles have sparked a new national self-examination.
sentence.Network_cn: 发生在洛杉矶的事件再次引发了全国范围的反思。

sentence.Network_en: Did you have to get through an entrance examination?
sentence.Network_cn: 你必须要通过入学考试吗？

the examination of active cardiac muscle ., 存活心肌的检测.

list.abs: 高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... ought to 应当；应该 examine vt 检查 plenty n 充足；大量；富裕.
初中英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... exam = examination n. 考试，测试；检查；审查 examine vt. 检查；诊察 example n. 例子；榜样.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in the sense 'testing (one's conscience) by a standard'): via Old French from Latin examinatio(n-), from examinare 'weigh, test' (see examine)

entry.def: An examination is a formal test that you take to show your knowledge or ability in a particular subject, or to obtain a qualification.
If you have a medical examination, a doctor looks at your body, feels it, or does simple tests in order to check how healthy you are.

means.word_mean: 1. the act of examining something closely (as for mistakes)
2. a set of questions or exercises evaluating skill or knowledge;

sentences.sentence: "when the test was stolen the professor had to make a new set of questions"

means.word_mean: 4. examination of conscience (as done daily by Jesuits)
5. the act of giving students or candidates a test (as by questions) to determine what they know or have learned

auth_sentence.content: Well, my medical examination is done and dusted.
auth_sentence.res_content: Well, my medical examination is done and dusted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Well, my medical examination is done and dusted.

auth_sentence.content: Such a project would never pass an EIS examination.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such a project would never pass an EIS examination.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such a project would never pass an EIS examination.

auth_sentence.content: Strategies of concealment ramify, and self-examination is endless.
auth_sentence.res_content: Strategies of concealment ramify, and self-examination is endless.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Strategies of concealment ramify, and self-examination is endless.

Sentence.sentence: I think they do better academically and you can measure that very crudely from the examination results,I also think they do better academically because they have more opportunities to take the leading role in discussions and in managerial responsibilities.
The publisher, fearful of being cheated, forced her to submit to his scholarly examination by a board of educated men, including the colonial governor

sentences.en: On further examination it was found that the signature was not genuine.
sentences.cn: 经过进一步的调查发现签名不是真的。

sentences.en: The doctor attended her immediately with a brief examination.
sentences.cn: 大夫立即给她迅速地检查了一下。

means.word_mean: 考试; 考查; 试题

sentences.en: Then came the day of his examination.
sentences.cn: 后来, 他考试的日子到了。

sentences.en: His statement won't bear the lawyer's examinations.
sentences.cn: 他的供述经不起律师的讯问。

jushi.english: On further examination it was found that the signature was not genuine.
jushi.chinese: 经过进一步的调查发现签名不是真的。

jushi.english: You have to pass the professional examination to be admitted to the society.
jushi.chinese: 你得参加业务考试,及格后,方能获准加入该社。

jushi.english: Her wedding clashed with my examination, so I couldn't go.
jushi.chinese: 她的婚礼与我的考试冲突,因此我无法参加。
